Manx: Cooinniee cre ta trimmid fuill Yeesey Chreest. Ta glenney voish dy chooilley pheccah. T’ee ny strymmey ayns shilley Yee. Ny peccaghyn yn slane seihll. As foddee oo ve shickyr jeh, dy vel ee ny strimmey na yn ayrn ayds, jeh yn deyrey shoh, cha vel eh madyr cre wheesh dy pheccah as t’ou er yannoo ny oi. Foddee oo fakin ayns fuill Yeesey leagh dy haualtys eekit un cheayrt, as er son dy bragh, as yn shee ayd rish Jee hannah jeant. Foddee oo goaill eh myr gioot voish Jee çhebbit dy nastee, da ooilley ny ta credjal, dy jean Jee yn spyrryd Noo shiu y leeidiel, gys yn irriney shoh dy haualtys amney as chur diu boggey, shee, as graih, ayns treishteil ayns fuill costlagh Yeesey Chreest ayns bea as ayns baase bee eh carrey dauesyn ta treisteil ayns e uill as lhiantyn hug y chrosh choud as t’ad ayns yn seihll shoh. As lurrg nyn maase, nee ad soie marish ayns Gloyr as gerjagh dy bragh farraghtyn.
English: Remember what the weight of the blood of Jesus Christ is that purifies every sin. It is heavier in the sight of God; the sins of the whole world. And you can be sure of it, that it is heavier than your part, of this sentence, it doesn't matter how much of sin you have done againt it. You can see in Jesus’ blood a reward of the salvation paid once, and for ever, and your peace with God already made. You can take it as a gift from God freely offered, for all those that believe, that God the Holy Spirit will lead you to this truth of soul salvation as give you joy, peace and love, in trusting in the precious blood of Jesus Christ in life and in death he will be a friend to those that trust in his blood and adhere to the cross whilst they are in this world. And after their death, they will sit with him in Glory and everlasting comfort.
Diplomatic: Cooinniee cre ta trymmyd fuill Yeesey Chreest. Ta glenney voish dy chooilley feccah Tee ny strymmey ayns shilley Yee. Ny peccaghyn yn slane seihll. As foddee oo ve shikker jeh, dy vel ee ny strymmey ny yn ayn ayds, jeh yn deyrey shoh, cha vel eh madyr, cre wheesh dy feccah as tow er yannoo ny oi. Foddee oo fakyn ayns fuill Yeesey. leagh dy hanaltys eekyt un cheayrt, as er son dy braagh As yn shee ayd rish jee hannah jeant Foddee oo ghoaill eh mor gooit voish Jee chebbyt dy nastee, da ooilley ny ta credjal, Dy jean Jee yn spyrryd Noo. Shiu y leeiddiel, gys yn eiryney Shoh dy haualtys amney as chur dieu boggey, shee, as graih, ayns treishteill ayns fuill costlagh Yeesey Chreest ayns bea as ayns baase bee eh charrey dauesyn ta treisteill ayns y uill as lhantyn hug y crosh choud as ta’d ayns yn seihll shoh. as lyrg nyn maase, nee ad soie marysh ayns Glooyr as gerjagh dy braagh farraghtyn
